verdict.summary: The AI Safety Filter is generally compliant with Indian regulations but requires improvements in areas of user complaint mechanism and potential fairness concerns.

issues.title: Missing User Complaint Mechanism
issues.description: Currently, the AI Safety Filter does not provide a mechanism for users to complain about violations of law or rules as required by Rule 3(1)(d) of The IT (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021.
issues.impact: Potential legal consequences for non-compliance with Indian regulations.
issues.remediation: Implement a mechanism for users to complain about violations of law or rules.

issues.title: Lack of Transparency and Fairness
issues.description: The AI Safety Filter removes content without human review, which may raise fairness concerns due to potential incorrect removals.
issues.impact: Negative user sentiment and potential legal consequences for lack of transparency and fairness.
issues.remediation: Implement a review process to address concerns about incorrect removals and improve transparency.

evidence_cited.content: Prohibits publishing or transmitting information that is obscene in electronic form
Requires significant social media intermediaries to provide a mechanism for users to complain about violations of law or rules
frameworks: The IT (Intermediary Guidelines and Digital Media Ethics Code) Rules, 2021
